column5: Assuming this all goes well Spiel will have some competition soon. I would like to start to build bamboo fly rods, done my research and still have a few questions. First is how can I tell low grade from high grade tonkin cane? Where can I get the cheapest aluminum planing board? Any other opinions or knowledge is welcome and appreciated, thank you!
Sounds like a pretty high ambition for someone to strive for. good luck.   Art
One tip i can offer is take your time, don't rush on any part, no matter how small it might be. Good luck   Jacob.
No competition to me, I don't do bamboo.  But good luck with your venture.  If you haven't looked here, you should.
I would guess you have already been there, but just in case, you would probably find more advice here.  http://www.rodbuildingforum.com/
Mine will be so good people will switch to bamboo.
The confidence is strong in this one
Yes it is, just finished my first split...
High quality tonkin cane will be very dense when you look at the end grain. Its very expensive and hard to find. Don't buy regular bamboo
Thanks M or S, ya this is cheap bamboo I got it to test with.
